conclusion: Coil ABCO has area = 0.4 m², Magnetic field B = 0.1 T in positive x-direction, Coil rotates 60° downward around z-axis from initial position
The coil ABCO initially lies in the xz-plane (since points A and C are in this plane). The normal vector to this coil is therefore along the y-axis.

premise: The angle between the magnetic field (x-direction) and the normal vector (y-direction) is 90°.
conclusion: Initial flux: Φ_i = B * A * cos(90°) = 0.1 * 0.4 * 0 = 0 Wb

premise: When the coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis, the normal vector to the coil rotates from the y-axis.
conclusion: This rotation moves the normal vector 60° from the y-axis toward the negative x-axis in the xy-plane. The new angle between the normal vector and the x-axis (magnetic field direction) becomes: θ_f = 90° - 60° = 30°
